Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Addit. 29729: in London, British Library Harley 2251 instead.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Bycorne and Chychevache’ — nineteen stanzas rhyme royal with occasional prose to introduce speakers

CamTCC599.First Lines:
[O] prudent folkes taketh hedeAnd remembre in your lyuesHow
                    thys story doth procedeOf the housbondes and her wyfes…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Of lyfe and deth betwyxt twaynelynked in a double
                    chayne
CamTCC599.Attributed Author:
Compyled by Iohn ludgate monke of berye at the request of a worthye
                    syttesyne of london to be peynted in a perler (added by a later hand, f.
                    159)
CamTCC599.Attributed Title: Expliciunt Balades of Bycorn and Chicheuache (f. 159)
CamTCC599.Facsimiles:
Fletcher,  Bradford Y. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Trinity R.3.19. A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, 1987. 

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.19.
         https://mss-cat.trin.cam.ac.uk/Manuscript/R.3.19.

CamTCC600.First Lines:
O prudent folkes takeþe heedAnd Remembreþe in youre
                    lyvesHowe þis story doþe procedeOf þe housbandes and
                    þeyre wyves…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Of lyff and deeth bytwix tweyneLynkeld in a double
                    cheyne
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
Þe fourome of desguysinges (added by later hand, top f. 10); Loo sirs
                    þe deuise of a peynted or desteynede clothe for an halle a parlour or a
                    chaumbre deuysed by Iohan Lidegate at þe request of a worþy citeseyn
                    of London ffirst þere shal stonde an ymage in poete wyse seying þees
                    thre balades (Shirley’s hand, f. 10)
